author: Staff Reporter
text:
In a bid to bring in transparency in the Public Distribution System (PDS) and functioning of ration shops, a social audit of ration shops’ accounts would be conducted at the grama sabha meetings to be held on January 26 (Republic Day). In the first phase, the scheme will be implemented in rural parts.

Collector R. Nanthagopal, in a press release said, ration shops in villages should submit a number of records for a period of six months for the social audit. This included ‘A’ registers, supply registers, stock registers and bill books. These should be submitted for the social audit during the grama sabha meetings.

He has asked public to take part in the grama sabha meeting and clarify doubts on the implementation of PDS.
title: Social audit of PDS at grama sabha meetings
